author: TODAY
description: The wedding of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and journalist Lauren Sánchez was a star-studded affair in Venice, Italy
title: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez's wedding guest list: Everyone who attended in Venice

author: Tim Stelloh
description: Bryan Kohberger, the man accused of fatally stabbing four college students in Idaho, appears ready to accept a deal to plead guilty in connection with the killings, one victim’s family and their attorney said Monday
title: Bryan Kohberger appears set to plead guilty in 4 Idaho college students' deaths

author: Anna Kaplan, TODAY
description: “M3GANs, can you look into the distance please?” a choreographer asks, watching a photo shoot unfold.
title: It’s the ‘M3GAN’ universe – and we’re all about to be living in it

author: Dennis Romero
description: A Los Angeles man who was in a law enforcement-like vehicle and detained said he’s being used as a “scapegoat” amid fears over immigration enforcement.
title: Man in law enforcement-like vehicle detained following warning about fake federal agents

author: Joseph Lamour, TODAY
description: Benson Boone and Crumbl are clearly flipping for one another
title: Benson Boone's Crumbl Cookies collaboration is getting an encore

author: Becca Wood, TODAY
description: A first look at “Project Hail Mary,” the upcoming science fiction thriller starring Ryan Gosling, captures how a middle school teacher is suddenly tasked with saving the world — from space
title: New trailer for 'Project Hail Mary' gives first look at Ryan Gosling in space

author: Daniel Arkin
description: This is a free article for Diddy on Trial newsletter subscribers.
title: Jury deliberations begin in Diddy’s racketeering and sex trafficking trial

author: Aria Bendix
description: More than 14 million people could die over the next five years because of the Trump administration’s dismantling of the U.S.
title: USAID cuts could lead to 14 million deaths over the next five years, researchers say

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: An 82-year-old woman who was injured in a firebombing attack in Boulder, Colorado, earlier this month has died
title: 82-year-old woman dies after Colorado attack on Israeli hostage advocates

author: The Politics Desk
description: Senate Republicans are racing toward the finish line on President Donald Trump's "big, beautiful bill," with several key members undecided.
title: The Senate races toward a 'big, beautiful' finish line: From the Politics Desk

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: "Starting this summer, NASA+ live programming will be available on Netflix," the space agency said in a news release on Monday.
title: Netflix shoots for the moon with new NASA content partnership

author: Zoë Richards
description: The lawsuit accused Selzer of fraud after she conducted a 2024 poll before that showed Kamala Harris leading Trump in Iowa. He ended up winning the state.
title: Trump drops lawsuit against Iowa pollster Ann Selzer and Des Moines Register newspaper

author: Curtis Bunn
description: People living and working in Haiti are questioning the Trump administration’s reasoning that it is safe enough for Haitians temporarily living in the U.S. to return to their embattled country of origin
title: The U.S. declared Haiti too dangerous for Americans but safe enough for Haitians to return to

author: Sean Conlon, CNBC
description: Stocks rose on Monday as traders closed out a stunning month with even more record highs
title: S&P 500 rises to another record to wrap up second-quarter comeback

author: Julie Tsirkin
description: President Donald Trump's sweeping domestic policy package that's moving through the Senate would impact virtually every American, overhauling tax, health care and energy policy.
title: Here's what's in the Senate's version of the 'big, beautiful bill'

author: The Associated Press
description: Top-ranked Aryna Sabalenka wouldn’t want women’s tennis to move to best-of-five-set matches at Grand Slam tournaments — like the men play — fearing higher injury risks.“Probably physically I’m one of the strongest ones, so maybe it would benefit me.
title: No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka not interested in best-of-five-set matches in women’s tennis

description: The suspect believed to have fatally shot two firefighters and wounded a third while crews responded to a raging brush fire in northwest Idaho has been identified. NBC News' Tom Winter reports on how authorities used the suspect's cell phone to track his location.
title: Suspect in Idaho firefighter ambush identified

author: Bram Sable-Smith | KFF Health News
description: Republicans have touted Medicaid work requirements both as a way to reduce federal spending on the program and as a moral imperative for Americans.
title: To keep Medicaid, a mom caring for her disabled adult son may soon need to prove she works

author: Spencer Kimball, CNBC
description: Clean energy stocks fell Monday as President Donald Trump’s spending legislation now includes a tax on wind and solar projects using Chinese components and abruptly phases out key credits
title: Clean energy stocks fall as Trump bill taxes components from China, phases out credits

author: Erik Ortiz
description: The suspect believed to have fatally shot two firefighters and wounded a third on Sunday while crews responded to a raging brush fire in northwest Idaho was identified on Monday as a 20-year-old man whose family says dreamed of one day becoming a firefighter himself
title: Suspect in Idaho firefighter ambush identified as Wess Roley

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: A father and child were rescued from the water after going overboard the Disney Dream cruise ship
title: Father and child rescued after going overboard Disney cruise ship

author: Matt Bradley
description: After unprecedented attacks on Iran, the U.S. and Israel have shifted toward an ambitious diplomatic push in the Middle East.
title: As dust settles on Iran, Israel focuses on diplomacy with Mideast neighbors

author: Shannon Pettypiece
description: The "big beautiful bill" gives big tax breaks to businesses and the wealthy, paid for partly by cutting health coverage for lower-income households.
title: Who wins and loses in Republicans' 'big, beautiful bill'

author: Kate Dore, CFP, CNBC
description: Google on Monday announced a partnership with Commonwealth Fusion Systems, or CFS, a private company spun off from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, which marks the tech giant′s first commercial commitment to fusion
title: Google makes first foray into fusion in venture with MIT spinoff Commonwealth Fusion Systems

author: Ryan J. Reilly
description: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration has sued the city of Los Angeles over its immigration policies, claiming that the city's law discriminates against federal law enforcement by treating them differently from other law enforcement authorities
title: Trump administration sues Los Angeles over sanctuary city immigration policies

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Harvard University is "in violent violation" of Title VI of the Civil Rights Act, the federal government’s Task Force to Combat Anti-Semitism said in a Monday letter threatening to cut all the school's federal funding if changes aren't made.
title: Harvard found in violation of Civil Rights Act over anti-semitism, Trump admin says

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — Democratic groups are kicking off a new community organizing effort this summer, taking aim at Republican priorities and widening their scope to include "non-political spaces" like book clubs and sports forums
title: Democratic groups target 'non-political spaces' in new campaign ahead of fall elections and 2026 midterms

author: David K. Li
description: The State Department on Monday announced it has banned an English rapper and his rap punk duo from performing in the United States after they appeared to lead a crowd in chants supporting besieged Gaza residents and wishing "death" upon Israeli forces, officials said
title: State Department bans visas for English punk duo Bob Vylan after Glastonbury performance

author: The Associated Press
description: The Miami Dolphins are sending All-Pro cornerback Jalen Ramsey, Pro Bowl tight end Jonnu Smith and a 2027 seventh-round draft pick to the Pittsburgh Steelers in exchange for All-Pro safety Minkah Fitzpatrick and a 2027 fifth-round pick
title: Dolphins trading Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith to Steelers for Minkah Fitzpatrick

description: The jury in the trial of Sean "Diddy" Combs has begun deliberations after hearing 34 witnesses called from the prosecution. NBC News' Chloe Melas reports on what evidence stands out the most from the trial.
title: Jury deliberations underway in Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial

author: The Associated Press
description: As vaccine hesitancy becomes more mainstream, some Americans are grappling with the reality of vaccine-preventable diseases
title: The life-changing impact of preventable diseases in the anti-vaccination era

author: Doha Madani
description: Deliberations are officially underway in the sex trafficking and racketeering case against Sean "Diddy" Combs as the judge turned the case over to the jury on Monday morning.
title: Jury begins deliberations in Sean 'Diddy' Combs' sex trafficking trial

author: The Associated Press
description: José Ramón Hernández Reyes, convicted of smuggling migrants and illegally reentering the U.S., can stay in the U.S. for at least another year, according to court records.
title: Key witness in Kilmar Abrego Garcia case spared from deportation

author: The Associated Press
description: STROUDSBURG, Pa. — A Pennsylvania judge on Monday ordered that three people whose testimony has been requested by defense attorneys will have to travel to Idaho to appear at the trial of a man accused of stabbing to death four college students in 2022
title: Judge says 3 witnesses sought by Bryan Kohberger must testify in Idaho college murders trial

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: AUBURN HILLS, Mich. — Ram CEO Tim Kuniskis reemerged from a seven-month retirement late last year saying he “missed the fight” and admitting the Stellantis brand was getting smashed in the marketplace by its competition
title: Inside Stellantis' plan to revive its Ram Trucks brand after yearslong sales declines

author: Sahil Kapur
description: The Republican-controlled Senate began voting on amendments to President Donald Trump's massive tax cut and spending bill, with the goal of passing it later in the day.
title: Senate begins voting on Trump's massive bill as Republicans race toward final passage

author: David K. Li
description: Caitlin Clark's version of a popular Nike sneaker dropped on Monday morning, and the WNBA superstar etched her name next to the late NBA icon Kobe Bryant.
title: Nike rolls out WNBA star Caitlin Clark's version of Kobe Bryant's sneaker

author: Melissa Repko, CNBC
description: Home Depot said Monday that it is buying GMS, a building-products distributor, for about $4.3 billion as the retailer moves to draw more sales from contractors and other home professionals
title: Home Depot is buying GMS for about $4.3 billion as retailer chases more home pros

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court ruled that a federal prison inmate cannot sue corrections officers for an alleged assault in which he was punched, kicked and had his face slammed into a wall.
title: Supreme Court rules prison inmate cannot sue federal officers for alleged assault

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday turned away without comment a claim brought by the group formerly run by Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Supreme Court turns away online censorship claim by RFK Jr.'s anti-vaccine group against Meta

author: The Associated Press
description: A group of Environmental Protection Agency employees on Monday published a declaration of dissent from the agency’s policies under the Trump administration, saying they “undermine the EPA mission of protecting human health and the environment.”More than 170 EPA employees put their names to the document, with about 100 more signing anonymously out of fear of retaliation, according to Jeremy Berg, a former editor-in-chief of Science magazine who is not an EPA employee but was among non-EPA s
title: EPA employees put names to 'declaration of dissent' over agency moves under Trump

author: The Associated Press
description: The WNBA is expanding to 18 teams over the next five years, with Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia all set to join the league by 2030
title: WNBA is expanding to Detroit, Philadelphia and Cleveland in next 5 years

author: The Associated Press
description: The monthlong celebration of LGBTQ Pride reached its rainbow-laden crescendo Sunday as huge crowds took part in jubilant, daylong street parties from New York to San Francisco
title: NYC, San Francisco and other U.S. cities cap Pride Month with a mix of party and protest

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Monday took up a new challenge to campaign finance restrictions in a case brought by Republicans seeking to overturn limits on party committees spending money in coordination with individual candidates
title: Supreme Court takes up major new challenge to campaign finance restrictions

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Foxes have been digging burrows and leaving their droppings at the site of Google's new headquarters in London's King's Cross neighborhood.
title: Outfoxed: Furry visitors slip into Google's new unfinished London headquarters

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Six people were killed in a small plane crash in northeast Ohio on Sunday morning, officials said.
title: Six killed in small plane crash in northeast Ohio

author: The Associated Press
description: Damion Downs scored in the sixth round of a shootout after three saves by Matt Freese, sending the U.S. to the semifinals of the CONCACAF Gold Cup with a 4-3 penalty-kicks win over Costa Rica after a 2-2 tie on Sunday night.
title: U.S. beats Costa Rica in thrilling penalty shootout to advance in Gold Cup

description: The Senate holds a marathon vote series on President Trump’s “Big, Beautiful Bill.”
title: Senate ‘vote-a-rama’ on GOP agenda bill

description: Canada rescinded its digital services tax one day before the first payments were due after President Donald Trump announced the U.S. would halt trade talks with its neighbor. NBC News' Yamiche Alcindor reports on why U.S. technology companies are praising Trump's decision.
title: Canada rescinds digital services tax after Trump says U.S. will halt trade talks

description: Israel is expanding its fight in the Gaza Strip, issuing evacuation orders in the densely populated Gaza City and ramping up strikes over the weekend. The shift in focus comes as President Donald Trump ramps up the pressure for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas and as a question mark still hangs over the status of Iran’s nuclear program. NBC’s Matt Bradley reports for TODAY.
title: Israel Intensifies Efforts in Gaza as Trump Again Calls for Ceasefire

author: Amina Kilpatrick
description: The Senate will begin ‘vote-a-rama’ today on President Donald Trump’s agenda bill.
title: Senate to begin 'vote-a-rama' on GOP bill and two firefighters killed in ambush: Morning Rundown

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Here are the five teams worth watching as NBA free agency officially kicks off Monday night.
title: Lakers and Rockets headline NBA teams worth watching as free agency kicks off

description: During the "vote-a-rama," senators are allowed to bring up an unlimited number of amendments to the bill for votes.
title: Senate to begin voting marathon on GOP agenda bill

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: Surrounded by bomb-struck buildings, Dr. Hussam Abu Safiya walked down the middle of a road strewn with debris, his white medical coat standing out against the rubble as he made his way toward Israeli tanks
title: Fears grow for Gaza hospital chief who walked toward Israeli tanks before arrest

author: Patrick Smith
description: An investigation is underway after authorities say a lone gunman started a fire and ambushed firefighters who responded to it in north-west Idaho on Sunday, allegedly shooting and killing two and seriously injuring another
title: 2 firefighters killed in Idaho after suspected gunman started fire as ambush, authorities say

author: The Associated Press
description: ROME — Major heat waves across southern Europe have pushed temperatures above 40 C (104 F) in countries including Italy, Spain and Greece, as local authorities issued fresh warnings against the risk of wildfires
title: Severe heat wave hits southern Europe and raises wildfire risks

author: Gretchen Morgenson
description: A forensic pension investigator was hired to provide clarity on CalPERS investments, the high fees it's paying to Wall Street firms and its lagging performance.
title: The nation's largest public pension fund faces a probe launched by concerned retirees

author: The Associated Press
description: D. Wayne Lukas, the Hall of Famer who became one of the most accomplished trainers in the history of horse racing and a face of the sport for decades, has died.
title: Hall of Fame horse trainer D. Wayne Lukas, a winner of 15 Triple Crown races, dies at 89

author: The Associated Press
description: Far-right Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, who has often defended Israelis accused of similar crimes, offered a rare condemnation of Sunday's violence.
title: Israeli settlers rampage at a military base in the West Bank

author: The Associated Press
description: A jury in Australia began deliberations in the trial of Erin Patterson, accused of killing her husband's relatives by  serving them poisonous mushrooms.
title: Verdict due in trial of Australian woman served deadly mushrooms with intent to kill her in-laws

author: The Associated Press
description: The Hafiz Gul Bahadur group, a faction of the Pakistani Taliban, claimed responsibility for the bombing in Northwest Pakistan’s Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.
title: Suicide car bombing in Pakistan kills 14 soldiers and injures 25 people

author: The Associated Press
description: MIAMI — A depression that was formerly Tropical Storm Barry dumped rain on eastern Mexico late Sunday as Tropical Storm Flossie brewed off its southwestern Pacific coast
title: Tropical depression dumps rain in eastern Mexico as Tropical Storm Flossie brews off west coast

author: Joe Kottke
description: Two teenage girls were shot near the Stonewall Inn as NYC Pride celebrations winded down on Sunday night, police said.
title: 2 teens shot near Stonewall Inn after NYC Pride march, police say

author: Lim Hui Jie, CNBC
description: Canada has walked back on its digital services tax “in anticipation” of a mutually beneficial comprehensive trade arrangement with the United States, Ottawa announced Sunday night, just one day before the first tax payments were due
title: Canada rescinds Digital Services Tax after Trump cuts off U.S. trade talks

description: Multiple firefighters have been shot in an apparent ambush while responding to a fire in Coeur D'Alene, Idaho. NBC News' Maya Eaglin has the latest on this developing story.
title: Multiple Firefighters Shot in Idaho

description: The fire that drew first responders to Canfield Mountain was intentionally set, officials say. Responding officers are still facing active sniper fire.
title: Man found dead with gun nearby after deadly shooting of Idaho firefighters
